summary: This document contains due diligence research results for Erika Kellerhals, including various searches for negative media, public records, and personal information. It highlights the absence of significant negative findings and provides details about her personal and professional affiliations. This document discusses a turnover action involving James P. Carroll, the Chapter 7 trustee for the bankruptcy estate of Jeffrey Prosser, who seeks to recover fraudulent transfers made to his wife, Dawn Prosser. The court reviews motions for judgment as a matter of law and for a new trial, ultimately denying both motions and affirming the jury's verdict in favor of Trustee Carroll. This document details the proceedings of a divorce case involving Julito A. Francis and Dr. Debra Wright-Francis, focusing on the equitable distribution of their marital property. The court addressed various motions and stipulations regarding the division of assets, including the marital homestead and personal property, as well as the financial circumstances of both parties. This document details the procedural history and court rulings regarding the divorce proceedings between Julito Francis and Dr. Wright-Francis. It outlines various motions filed by both parties concerning custody, visitation, and the division of marital assets, including financial disputes and the valuation of their marital homestead. This document discusses the equitable distribution of marital property in the divorce proceedings between Mr. Francis and Dr. Wright-Francis. It addresses the division of retirement accounts and the status of Dr. Wright-Francis' medical degree as marital property, ultimately concluding that both parties are entitled to retain their respective retirement accounts and that Dr. Wright-Francis' medical degree is her separate property.

events.description: The court issued an opinion memorandum denying Dawn Prosser's motions for judgment as a matter of law and for a new trial.

events.title: Divorce Trial
events.description: The trial for the divorce case between Julito A. Francis and Dr. Debra Wright-Francis took place, addressing the division of marital property.

events.title: Decree of Divorce
events.description: A decree of divorce was entered, officially dissolving the marriage between Julito A. Francis and Dr. Debra Wright-Francis.

events.title: Final Hearing
events.description: A final hearing was held to resolve outstanding issues regarding the distribution of personal property.

events.title: Response to Divorce Petition
events.description: Dr. Wright-Francis filed an answer to the divorce petition.

events.title: Divorce Decree Issued
events.description: The Court issued a Divorce Decree to the parties, reserving determination on issues of custody and property.

events.title: Status Conference
events.description: The parties informed the Court that they had reached an agreement regarding custody and visitation.

events.title: Purchase of Condominium
events.description: Dr. Wright-Francis purchased a unit at the Towers Condominiums.

events.title: Court Refusal to Determine Motion
events.description: The Court refused to make a determination on Dr. Wright-Francis' show cause motion due to lack of sufficient evidence.

events.title: Court Order on Property
events.description: The Court issued an order regarding the parties' conduct concerning marital property.

keyFacts: The due diligence report on Erika Kellerhals found no significant negative media results.
Erika Kellerhals has multiple addresses listed in St. Thomas, VI.
The report includes various name variations for Erika Kellerhals.
Several possible relatives of Erika Kellerhals are mentioned, including Edward and Kathleen Kellerhals.
The document is marked confidential and is part of a compliance review process.
The court denied Dawn Prosser's motion for judgment as a matter of law, stating that sufficient evidence was presented regarding Jeffrey Prosser's ownership of the assets.
The court found that insolvency was not an essential element for all claims brought by Trustee Carroll.
Alan Barbree testified about the ownership of assets transferred from Jeffrey Prosser to Dawn Prosser.
The jury returned a verdict in favor of Trustee Carroll against Dawn Prosser.
Dawn Prosser's arguments regarding waiver of certain claims were deemed invalid by the court.
Julito A. Francis and Dr. Debra Wright-Francis were married on August 17, 1991.
They have two children: Brooklyn J. Francis, born on March 6, 2000, and Saryn J. Francis, born on January 27, 1993.
The marital homestead is valued at $725,000, subject to a mortgage of $110,000.
Julito A. Francis was terminated from his position as CEO of the Virgin Islands Next Generation Network in October 2011.
Dr. Wright-Francis is a medical OB-GYN with contracts for medical services totaling approximately $200,000 annually.
Julito Francis filed for divorce on November 4, 2010.
Dr. Wright-Francis filed an emergency motion alleging that Julito Francis violated a court order by withdrawing funds from his retirement account.
The court found that Julito Francis had wasted marital assets by withdrawing significant amounts from his retirement account.
Dr. Wright-Francis is seeking half of the value of the marital homestead and claims that her medical license is marital property.
Erika Kellerhals testified that Julito Francis' financial records were incomplete and indicated potential commingling of funds.
Mr. Francis has approximately $500,000 in his retirement account.
Dr. Wright-Francis has an amount exceeding $500,000 in her retirement account, but the exact amount is unknown.
The Court determined that Dr. Wright-Francis' medical degree is her separate property and not subject to equitable distribution.
Both parties failed to provide sufficient evidence for the division of their retirement accounts.
The Court found no evidence that Mr. Francis excessively spent or wasted marital assets.
